para.sentence: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\sin z=\cos z, , \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\cos z=-\sin z, , \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\tan z={\sec^{2}}z, , \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\csc z=-\csc z\cot z, , \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\sec z=\sec z\tan z, , \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}z}\cot z=-{\csc^{2}}z, , \frac{{\mathrm{d}}^{n}}{{\mathrm{d}z}^{n}}\sin z=\sin\left(z+\tfrac{1}{2}n\pi \right), , \frac{{\mathrm{d}}^{n}}{{\mathrm{d}z}^{n}}\cos z=\cos\left(z+\tfrac{1}{2}n\pi \right).

With a\neq 0 , the general solutions of the differential equations \frac{{\mathrm{d}}^{2}w}{{\mathrm{d}z}^{2}}+a^{2}w=0, , \left(\frac{\mathrm{d}w}{\mathrm{d}z}\right)^{2}+a^{2}w^{2}=1, , \frac{\mathrm{d}w}{\mathrm{d}z}-a^{2}w^{2}=1, are respectively w=A\cos\left(az\right)+B\sin\left(az\right), , w=(1/a)\sin\left(az+c\right), , w=(1/a)\tan\left(az+c\right), where A,B,c are arbitrary constants.
For other differential equations seeKamke (1977, pp. 355–358 and 396–400).
